body.head: Louis [Lajos; Ludwig] (Carl Paul) Thern (born Budapest, Dec 18, 1848; died Vienna, March 12, 1920)

div.p: Louis [Lajos; Ludwig] (Carl Paul) Thern (born Budapest, Dec 18, 1848; died Vienna, March 12, 1920), Hungarian pianist, studied piano with Carl Reinecke and Ignaz Moscheles at the Leipzig Conservatory (1864/65), and also with Liszt. Having started his concert career in 1866, he moved to Vienna in 1880, was professor of piano at the Horak'sche Musikschule 1884-, and professor of piano at the Vienna Conservatory from 1900 to his retirement in November 1919 or the end of the 1919/20 academic year (in 1905 he was teaching in the piano Vorbildungsschule).
Sources: oeML OnlineMusikbuch aus Oesterreich, ed. R. Heuberger (Vienna and Leipzig, 1905) Tittel, E., Die Wiener Musik Hochschule (Vienna: Lafite, 1967)
